page.title: 01The Whitminster Area.
page.content:
The area we have surveyed lies about seven miles south-west of the city of Gloucester. The area is basically agricultural, given over mostly to dairy farming with a small amount of arable farming. The small village of {Whitminster}lies nearly at the centre of the block. The village dates back to the time of the original Domesday Book.
The block has always contained several main transport routes up the Severn Valley. Today it contains part of the main A38, part of which follows the route of an old Roman road, the M5, with Junction 13 on the southern boundary of the block and a small section of the Gloucester and Sharpness Canal.
